description.narrative:
COSACA through Save the Children will distribute 4,000 hygiene kits and 1,100 dignity kits to affected communities in Zambezia. Thehygiene kits will include: comb, finger nail clipper, shampoo and body wash 4oz, deodorant soap 3oz, toothbrush toothpaste2.75oz, wash cloth, and a hand towel. In addition, prepositioned buckets and 10 L collapsible jerry cans will be distributed based on need to3,500 households. Dignity kits will be distributed to 1,100 women and girls of menstrual age that require items needed to maintain feminine hygiene, dignity and respect in their daily lives, including sanitary cloths, underwear in varying sizes and bar soap (250gms).
These kits have been developed based on assessed needs and are in line with the WASH sector recommendations and the Governmentof Mozambique. Special arrangements will be made for individual beneficiaries who are unable to reach the NFI distribution points, including delivery of NFIs for disabled and elderly persons, if needed.
COSACA, through SCI, will provide 300 households with a child under two with one Baby Care Kit funded through matching grant from Lutheran World Relief in Zambezia. This kit includes: cottont-shirts, gowns/pyjamas, receiving blankets, cloth diapers with pins, hooded jacket, pair of socks, hand towel, and a bar of soap. These kits have been designed based on assessed needs and will be distributed based on identified needs. Special arrangements will be made for individual beneficiaries who are unable to reach the NFI distribution points. Delivery of NFIs for disabled beneficiarieswill be conducted.

participating-org.narrative: Save The Children International Children Protection Organization

Save the Children International Save is a non-governmental organization for the defense of children's rights in the world, was established in the UK in 1919, dedicated to both provide emergency humanitarian aid as the long-term development through the child sponsorship . Save the Children began working in Mozambique in 1984, providing emergency assistance to children and families displaced bywar, and gave their contribution to the reconstruction of the health system. Since 1995, Save the Children in Mozambique has workedwith local communities and organizations to design Sponsorship programs for kids. Targeted to help children from early childhood toearly adulthood, our programs work to make a healthy and safe environment where children can learn andgrow. Our early childhood programs help prepare toddlers and young children for school by giving them access to quality preschools and early literacy programs, while our programs designed for primary school-aged kids work to transform students into lifelong learners by building strong curriculums and passionate teachers. Our work with adolescents focuses on that challenging transition between childhood and adulthood, helping ensure it#s a positive one by teaching them money, job and relationship skills. We also provide health education and care to children in need through our school health programs to help children stay healthy, well-nourished and in school. Thanks to the generoussupport from our community of sponsors, these essential programs in Mozambique continue to give children a healthy start and the opportunity to learn, protecting them from harm along the way.
